articles.author: TARA COPP
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. has approved $20 billion in arms sales to Israel, including scores of fighter jets and advanced air-to-air missiles, the State Department announced Tuesday.
articles.title: US approves $20 billion in weapons sales to Israel amid threat of wider Middle East war

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — International mediators are hoping to kickstart stalled cease-fire negotiations between Israel and Hamas with a new round of talks meant to finally clinch a deal between the sides. But the chances of a breakthrough appear slim.
articles.title: A new round of Gaza cease-fire talks is starting. Why is a deal so elusive?

articles.author: DAN MERICA, NICHOLAS RICCARDI and CHRIS MEGERIAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden, watching tens of thousands of migrants from Central America reach the U.S.-Mexico border just a few months into his administration, tapped his second-in-command to help address the influx — a decision that has exposed Vice President Kamala Harris to one of her biggest political liabilities.
articles.title: Presented with rise in border crossings, Harris chose a long-term approach to the problem

articles.author: LINLEY SANDERS and JONATHAN J. COOPER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris has a perceived advantage over former President Donald Trump on several leadership qualities such as honesty, a new poll from The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research finds, although Americans are slightly more likely to trust Trump on the economy and immigration.
articles.title: Americans give Harris an advantage over Trump on honesty and discipline, an AP-NORC poll finds

articles.author: STEVE KARNOWSKI
articles.description: MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — Democratic U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar, one of the progressive House members known as the “Squad” and a sharp critic of how Israel has conducted the war in Gaza, has won her primary race in Minnesota.
articles.title: US Rep. Ilhan Omar, a member of the progressive ‘Squad,’ wins Democratic primary in Minnesota

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: ASHEVILLE, N.C. (AP) — Donald Trump will have another opportunity Wednesday to recalibrate his presidential comeback bid, this time with a rally and speech in North Carolina that his campaign is billing as a significant economic address.
articles.title: Donald Trump is going to North Carolina for an economic speech. Can he stick to a clear message?

articles.author: DÁNICA COTO
articles.description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico (AP) — Tropical Storm Ernesto was poised to become a hurricane shortly after brushing past Puerto Rico late Tuesday as officials closed schools, opened shelters and moved dozens of the U.S.
articles.title: A strengthening Ernesto is poised to become a hurricane after brushing past Puerto Rico

articles.author: ILLIA NOVIKOV and BARRY HATTON
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia said Tuesday that its forces checked an effort by Ukrainian troops to expand a stunning weeklong incursion into the Kursk region, as a Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesperson said Kyiv has no intention of occupying Russian territory.
articles.title: Russia says it thwarted a Ukrainian charge to expand its incursion. Kyiv says it won't occupy land

articles.author: MARI YAMAGUCHI
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, in a surprise move Wednesday, announced he will not run in the upcoming party leadership vote in September, paving the way for Japan to have a new prime minister.
articles.title: Japan's Kishida announces he will not run in September, paving the way for a new prime minister

articles.author: RIAZAT BUTT
articles.description: KABUL, Afghanistan (AP) — It’s been three years since the Taliban took control of Afghanistan.
articles.title: The Taliban have ruled Afghanistan for 3 years. Here are 5 things to know
